reviewText:
The controls take some getting used to, but the game is damn fun once you figure them out.

Unlike most shooters, players have an insane amount of mobility, and the ability to slow time at will. You can leap through the air, powerslide along the ground, and climb ledges. Naturally this degree of mobility will lead to some really awesome kills, which the game rewards you with a second or two of slow-motion. This basically encourages players to not stay in one spot, and kill enemies in very stylish ways.

Another mechanic the game has which takes some getting used to is random objectives. Primarily the game is a deathmatch, but once in a while the game will give players an objective, such as being the first to reach a specific point, or kill a certain player before the rest. Naturally you are rewarded points by being the first to do so, and can make the difference between winning and losing a match.

The game isn't perfect, though, and I do have some gripes about it. As I said before the controls are pretty strange, and take some time to figure out. The game teaches various gameplay mechanics and stunts via popup windows during gameplay, which can be distracting. reviewText:
Once you know your controls, all you have to do is let loose. If you ever wanted to be in a ridiculous John Woo movie, this game is for you. The controls are responsive, hit reg is solid even during lag spikes, and every weapon (including your own fists!) feel strong like they should. You can even change between third and first person

On occasion you will encounter bugs, but they aren't anything game breaking. At the very worst, someone can just kill you or you can commit suicide to get out of them. The spawn times are very short anyway.

Level design is great. Plenty of things to vault over, take cover, slide under, and flip off of on every map.

Slow-motion is a very awesome feature. Everyone gets slowed but the person who triggers it isn't slowed as much. There is the reflex perk that increases this too.

The perks are nice additions to support different play styles.

Scoring is only dependent on points, and you get these points by completing the random objectives or dealing damage/scoring kills in very stylish ways, so it's a breath of fresh air from the bog standard K/D/A.

Again, highly recommended if you're a John Woo movie fan or like games like Max Payne.

Wow.

I've been playing quite a few free and paid shooters, and there's something about this one that seems so much more satisfying.  It might have something to do with the fact that I can jump-dive up to people who are using shotguns and and fully automatic rifles, punch them in the face, and get a kill.

I enjoy less realistic casual FPS games, and although this is mostly TPS (you can go into first person, but that seems limiting), it is probably the most fun I've had with an arcade shooter in awhile.

I don't even really have any complaints.  Awkward to get used to, but the controls also give so many options for mobility (you can do very weird maneuvers chaining wall jumps, ledge grabs and dives).  I find it very hard to hit people with guns, but I think I'm just too used to other games.  I can still score pretty high using fists.

Assuming this gameplay doesn't get boring fast, I look forward to the future.

I very much hope the developer keeps polishing this game and adding content.

The game is pretty fast-paced and in thrid person.

reviewText:
Double Action: Boogaloo is a lighthearted shooter sure to bring about some laughs with your mates. Choose 1 of several perks, choose your weapons, then fly through the air in combat.
Attack: Left click is shoot, Middle Wheel click is melee, f is grenade if you have it equipped
Stunts: Right click makes you tackle-dive, ctrl then right click makes you slide-tackle. In most cases it is good to always be using your stunts
Shift: more accurate aim, very useful with the Vindicator rifle on the rooftop map
C: activate slow motion if you have time built up
B: Switch your weapons or ablility at any time

My Strategy: Brawler with Vindicator + H.E. Grenade or Brawler with Vindicator + Undertaker
Vindicator is a powerful rifle decent for short/mid range, but great at long distance. Use Shift to snipe a few players before propelling your body head first to the lower rooftop, guns blazing.
Grenade is good for multikills, and areas where players mosh together, not much else to say about that.
Undertaker is a fast sub machine gun for close quarters. It works will with the Vindicator in that once you empty the vindicator's clip, you can quickly switch to the Undertaker to get a quick life-saving kill before reloading your primary.
MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE
Did I mention that you should melee as a brawler? Your melee strength is higher as a brawler, and kills, especially melee kills, build up a brawler bar. Once it is in the 80s or higher range, you can switch to your fists by pressing 1 and then left click. Your fists should be glowing. Now run around spamming left and right click, you will rack up tons of multikills on close-quarter parts of maps, like on Rooftop.
Today is my first day playing this game, but I have to say it's a good game utilizing the Source Engine pretty will. It's a nice break from more serious shooters, and will surely be one to play with your pals.

reviewText:
This game is, in my humble oppinion, something of a hidden gem here on Steam. The game is not for everyone, but for those who enjoy running arround and slowing down time every thirty seconds while constantly trying to kill people with a SMG, or having a battle in a dark room filled with clouds of money, 100 dollar bills that float around as you fire your shotgun madly trying to hit someone, I do recomend this game.

For a FTP like this, you need to think not if the game is worth your money, but if it is worth your time. And this game is very much worth your time. And it very much is.

Cons:
-A few guns, many of which are copies with different stats
-It can be hard to find a good server with enough people
-The graphics are meh, and also not the point

Pros:
-It is free
-Every build has a place and time to shine
-Variaty of maps
-The guns all feel different
-It is free
-Runs on my Mom's old laptop
-Doesn't take itself too seriously
-No pesky story to get in the way of shooting people with style
-The AI is both dumb and OP at the same time
-It is free
-The shotgun is a sniper rifle

reviewText:
I left a review quite some time ago before the recent update, and I figure I should update my review with how I feel about the game lately. I hadn't had a chance to play the update until today, and I have to say, I'm impressed with the new maps, but the new update is still lacking something the game's needed for a while, and that's a rebalancing. Matches with just a few people can feel relatively empty depending on the map size and density, but another map entirely might feel fine with that same amount. If there are a lot of players in any map things really get intense because you can evade one firefight and end up in another, it's all out warfare, but there's also a chance you can die before you really get to have any fun.
The guns are still the same as before the update which I'm disappointed to see, because the Persuader still one shots at mid- to short range. The fun of this game is having an intense ridiculous firefight while diving and sliding around with your opponent in a hail of bullets and trying to keep the reticule focused on them to whittle their health down before they whittle down yours- a fancy DPS race of sorts. All of this fun melts away when you die in a split second because somebody's using the Persuader. I really think it deserves a nerf so firefights with Persuader users can still be fun since you're not dying instantly, more of a challenge rather than an instant death scenario, for both players. I did read that there was an update regarding the Persuader, but it really didn't change much in regards to gameplay, it's still used the same way.
I've never cared much for the music of the game, as I normally play music from other games while I play. While the music additions are cool and fit the tone for the game well, I probably won't be listening to them any time soon.
Honestly, I'm really glad this game's still getting attention, even after over a year of seemingly being forgotten by the developers. It's a really quirky and gimmicky game which can make for some really memorable experiences. There aren't many other games where you can say you did a slo-mo backflip off of a wall and riddled somebody with bullets before sliding past their corpse on your stomach into the next firefight.
Overall, I'm pleased with the new update (balancing aside) and I'm curious to see what future updates can give us. Maybe more characters? A new class? New game types? An offline single-player challenge mode against Bots? Custom soundtrack? It may be a lot to expect from a free game, but a man can dream.

reviewText:
I left a review quite some time ago before the recent update, and I figure I should update my review with how I feel about the game lately. I hadn't had a chance to play the update until today, and I have to say, I'm impressed with the new maps, but the new update is still lacking something the game's needed for a while, and that's a rebalancing. Matches with just a few people can feel relatively empty depending on the map size and density, but another map entirely might feel fine with that same amount. If there are a lot of players in any map things really get intense because you can evade one firefight and end up in another, it's all out warfare, but there's also a chance you can die before you really get to have any fun.
The guns are still the same as before the update which I'm disappointed to see, because the Persuader still one shots at mid- to short range. The fun of this game is having an intense ridiculous firefight while diving and sliding around with your opponent in a hail of bullets and trying to keep the reticule focused on them to whittle their health down before they whittle down yours- a fancy DPS race of sorts. All of this fun melts away when you die in a split second because somebody's using the Persuader. I really think it deserves a nerf so firefights with Persuader users can still be fun since you're not dying instantly, more of a challenge rather than an instant death scenario, for both players. I did read that there was an update regarding the Persuader, but it really didn't change much in regards to gameplay, it's still used the same way.
I've never cared much for the music of the game, as I normally play music from other games while I play. While the music additions are cool and fit the tone for the game well, I probably won't be listening to them any time soon.
Honestly, I'm really glad this game's still getting attention, even after over a year of seemingly being forgotten by the developers. It's a really quirky and gimmicky game which can make for some really memorable experiences. There aren't many other games where you can say you did a slo-mo backflip off of a wall and riddled somebody with bullets before sliding past their corpse on your stomach into the next firefight.
Overall, I'm pleased with the new update (balancing aside) and I'm curious to see what future updates can give us. Maybe more characters? A new class? New game types? An offline single-player challenge mode against Bots? Custom soundtrack? It may be a lot to expect from a free game, but a man can dream.

It is completely free with no microtransactions.

With that in mind I think any flaws the game has is mostly forgivable. I mean seriously it would have to be really ♥♥♥♥ to hate right?

So what is it about?

You do a variety of rolls, wall flips, and slides to take out the other players in a quick and hard to hit fashion.  Unfortunatly this looks more like everyone is just mindlessly sliding but they are still VERY hard to hit if they do it right.

There is so many ways to play but staying completely still is usually a horrific idea. Keep moving and dodging and people will have a tough time. Getting cornered can usually get you killed.

Weapons are varied but they all seem to be overpowered if used right. I can't argue that it is not balanced because they ALL seem to be powerful if used correctly.(Shotgun users camp doors, Macdaddy users slide in and go for the head, Akimbo users try to be precise, and everyone trys to make the best use of their guns to win)

Maps was not always my cup of tea but a really good map was one with city towers. You could jump from building to building and barely make it. Making for intense gameplay. A lot of times you could nearly fall to your death.

So overall I think this is a good game. It is free, good, and really deserves your attention.

reviewText:
If the Matrix and Max Payne had a baby and decided to raise it, it would be Double Action: Boogaloo.  This game is one of the most ridiculous games you may ever play.

The graphics are pretty terrible for a Source engine, but that doesn't make too much of a difference.  The game itself is not supposed to be gritty, down to earth, realistic, or anything like CoD or Battlefield.  Instead, think of Counter Strike with all the fun mods you could squeeze into it and then slimmed down to only include the ones that make you giggle like a schoolgirl being complimented about by the class clown.

The game itself is like Max Payne in that, you have ridiculous jumps and dives with a time warp function.  It's like Matrix in that you don't have to even begin to pay attention to ammo count (what is that?)...and time warp function.  You can choose to play first or third person, and the whole game (while still having objective modes) is about running around diving through the air and massacreing 15 other people in the same server as you.  Stupidly simply, simplisticly funny, hours of fun for the whole family.  Have fun spotting the two people having dolphin wars flopping around on the floor in circles trying to shoot each other.

Need I say more?

reviewText:
Intriguing. Needs polish but worth a try for the laughs.

I distinctly remember seeing this game several days ago and paying it no mind, thinking it was just a bunch of Source engine trash. First impressions were quite mediocre but I would say the game has very quickly grown on me.

First the good. it is legitiamately fun. No seriously, the floaty controls and ice rink surfaces make for an incredibly fast paced and twitchy shooter. Not for everyone but it does appeal to peopel who like the acrobactic martial arts gun-fu style of combat in movies such as Die Hard and The Matrix (Hell theres a Matrix poster in one of the levels...). The gun sounds are satisfying and the animations, while crude, get the job done. The standard deathmatch mode, with all its hilarity, are punctuated by micro-objectives such as a race from point to point or a wanted system. Completing these objectives gives buffs and bonues to the player who won these challenges, adding another dimension to gameplay. The greatest strength this title has is in its hilarity and its lack of taking itself seriously. Surprisingly enough, for a game that encourages player to run around like chickens with thier heads cut off, glitches are not very common. That may be a personal experience however.

Unfortunately the game suffers at this moment from a severe lack of content. With only three playble characters, a relatively small menagiere of weapons and limited number of maps, the game does tend to get boring playing online quickly (I could only handle 30-40 minute spurts before getting bored). Additions of more gamemodes would be welcome as while the standard deathmatch mode is fun; the boring factor does tend to set in quickly.

Weapon balance may also be taken into consideration. The persuader (shotgun) does tend to dominate and in massive battles, it quickly degenerates into a persuader fest. The vindicator (FN FAL) and the Black magic (M16) also are normally not ideal as long range in this game is basically two rooms over, still shotgun distance. The Mac Daddy (Mac 10) with its higher damage and rate of fire dominates the Undertaker (MP5K). The single pistols are useless. Enough said.
Weapon balance could be tweaked.

The frantic movement of the player models and such also may prove a heath hazard. I do not recommend playing this game if you easily suffer from any sort of motion sickness. This could prove lethal.

Despite its obvious lack of polish, I still rather like the game. Its not for everyone, fans of tactical shooters such as Insurgency, ARMA and Counter-Strike (I personally dont think thats tactical at all) will most definately not like this. Visually its choppy, laggy and uninspiring. Its disorientating, confusing and infuriating at times. Gameplay wise however, it offers something that you just dont find in F2P games these days. Did i mention it was free? The Developers obviously have put quite a bit of love into this game and I am personalyl interested in how they will take this game.
In the end, despite its faults (and there are many...), I do recommend picking this up to mess around with friends on a private server. The results are just...magical.

Great fun. Every one who likes shooting games should play this.
